history.content: I TA'd as an 8 hour and took 161 + 162. It was definitely doable, 161 and 162 has a bit of overlap. I think performance in 61C may be able to predict how you will feel with 161 and 162. 162 will push you into the deep-end and your familiarity of C will be crucial. Same thing for 161 (although it will be more emphasized in the first module of the course). I would say the workload will be moderate. Definitely make sure to finish your projects as soon as possible. I have heard that TA appointments have gotten more difficult due to remote learning (my experience is from a non-remote semester so YMMV).

children.subject: My experience with the class is a couple of years out-dated, but I would say 161 projects had less workload out of the three. 162 had the highest workload (homeworks due every other week and projects as well). 61C comes right after, with 162 slightly ahead. 161 had 3 projects. I found the 2nd project (the secure file system one) to be the most time consuming. So I would say 162 > 61C > 161

Agreed with @Calc, haven't taken 162 but I would add that most of 161 doesn't depend too heavily on your performance in 61c (I got a B in 61C and an A- in 161 the next semester, pretty close to an A). 161 has far less total work than 61C IMO, but the material is just slightly trickier. The projects in 161 have very disproportionate workload (at least, in the version I took). The memory safety project that relied most on 61C knowledge mainly required a solid understanding of C buffers/strings/etc. and stack/code memory structure (not even the 61C memory allocation stuff with all the calculations, literally just how the stack looks). That project was the medium-heavy one, comparable to 61C projects in workload but probably more conceptually challenging, and it was actually pretty fun. The heaviest project by far was the file system project for the cryptography portion, and it had pretty much nothing to do with 61C knowledge (we implemented it in Go, but even then most of the work was with paper and pencil, designing the system). The last project for us was in web security and it took less time than the HW assignments. I hear 162 is a huge time sink so it may actually be a nice class to pair with it since most of 161 will not be super time-consuming (except the file system project, you will need to spare some time for that one). Seems 161+162 will be pretty similar to EE16B+61c in terms of workload so if you are trying to avoid that much work, you probably will not with 161+162. It may make it more manageable knowing that 161+162 are probably going to be more enjoyable content-wise and have more overlap in understanding than 16B+61C.

thanks poet for the detailed explanation! I'm cutting down on extracurricular stuff and trying to manage my time better lol (and also set boundaries for how long project based classes are allowed to dig into my time for other things, but umm we'll see how that goes) so hopefully the workload feels a little more balanced; based on the rest of your comment it seems like a good choice to go for.

does anyone have any thoughts on partner vs no partner for 161 projects? I know it's a significant factor in success in 162 but just wondering if for 161 it's just a matter of a little less workload if you get a partner to do things with, or there's anything else I must consider. ty!

Bot here. Projects 1 and 3 are very doable with one person, though a project partner is highly recommended for project 2. Project 2 has a lot of open ended design work which could benefit from an extra brain. Note this is different from 162 projects where the design must be figured out, but correct designs are limited to couple variations. Bot has noticed a single person group is more prone to being rabbitholed into a nonfunctional design as there is no second brain to check their work. It is not impossible to do the project alone, but it is designed as a work for two.

thanks calc, that's helpful insight! I've been finding 61c challenging workload-wise but definitely doable. how do 161 projects compare to 61c or 162 projects? is a partner needed in 161 to do well, or are the projects doable alone?

history.content:
I am planning on taking these classes (161/162) together, another breadth, and an 8 hour TA position, plus budgeting ample time for the necessary evil that is the job hunting / networking / leetcode grind.. as well as having a little bit of chill time of course. I want to know about how much time 162 and 161 will take, considering any overlap in content between the classes? for context, I'm finding 61c rn doable but definitely a time sink from my other classes this semester. also, the class I am wanting to TA for will require me to spend some extra time brushing up so I'm estimating that will take about 10ish hours. 

this semester, I took ee16b/61c, 2 breadths, and had ~17 hrs/wk of extracurricular commitments, and with the online semester and everything, it was definitely quite a lot and I've been stressed way more than I'd like to be. with that context, is my upcoming schedule more doable, or also a death wish? any suggestions for what I can do instead? I definitely will be keeping 162, and would really like to do the TAing. my 162 group is people I know already so I'm looking forward to the group not being bad but I want to budget extra time just in case.

thanks in advance!
history.subject: how much workload will cs162 and cs161 be combined? (pls rate my schedule)
